DataElement.preferredName: Outpatient Completion Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation Intention Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the intent was to complete the hematopoietic cell transplantation as an outpatient.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Outpatient Completion Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation Intention
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A patient who comes to a healthcare facility for diagnosis or treatment but is not admitted for an overnight stay._To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion._Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species._An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Outpatient Complete Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A patient who comes to a healthcare facility for diagnosis or treatment but is not admitted for an overnight stay.:To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.:Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.

Concepts.definition: A patient who comes to a healthcare facility for diagnosis or treatment but is not admitted for an overnight stay.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.

Property.preferredDefinition: Intent; an anticipated outcome that is intended or that guides your planned actions.

Concepts.definition: An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Unk ND NA Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes, no, unknown, not done or not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or completed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Unknown Not Done Not Applicable Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.:Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or completed.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
